climbs.name: No Entra du Canada
climbs.fa: Jake Urban, Jamie Struck - FFA EricPospesil, Ajilla Pospesil 1999

content.description: Very aesthetic, long line up the center of the shield following the large left leaning crack and shooting slightly to the right at a solid finger crack.
content.protection: One bolt at the beginning of the route. Gear is tricky, but likely doesn't warrant a PG-13. Bolted anchor at the top.
content.location: Route up the middle of the "Canadian Shield"

content.description: Great movement on a fun arete with careful feet and good hands. It was funny hearing the history of the route from Jamie Struck who I believe was preset for the FA.
content.protection: 4 bolts with relatively good gear after. Bolted anchor at the top
content.location: Obvious arete up the left side of the "Canadian Shield"

content.description: Single pitch crag on the far right side of the cliff. Home to a few wheeler classics including "no entre du canada" and "3/8ths my ass"
